verses.text: 但以理被立為監察司大利烏按自己的心意，立了一百二十個總督，治理全國；

words.note: A high-ranking official in ancient Persian empires.
A high-ranking provincial official, similar to a satrap.

verses.text: 他又在這些總督之上，設立三位監察司（但以理是其中之一），監管總督的工作，免得王受虧損。

words.note: Often refers to financial or material loss.

verses.text: 因為但以理裡面有美好的靈性，所以各方面都比其他的監察司和總督優勝；王有意立他治理全國。

words.note: Refers to a person's spiritual quality or character.

words.definition: to intend, to have a mind to

verses.text: 引起同僚的嫉妒與謀害於是這些監察司和總督在但以理治國的事上，尋找把柄控告他，只是不能找到任何的把柄和過失，因為他忠心可靠，他們找不到他的任何錯誤和過失。

words.note: Used as a postposition with '在...事' to indicate 'on the matter of'.
Refers to a handle that can be used against someone, a weakness or fault.

verses.text: 那些人就說：「如果我們要控告這但以理，就只有在他 神的律法中去找把柄。」

words.definition: to want to, to be going to

words.note: A special character (ideographic space) used in Chinese Bibles to show reverence before the name of God.
Indicates direction or purpose of the following action.

verses.text: 這些監察司和總督就相約前來見王，對他說：「願大利烏王萬歲！

words.note: Ancient official title.
High-ranking official in ancient empires.
Used as a title after a king's name.
Lit. 'ten thousand years', a traditional acclamation for rulers.

verses.text: 國中所有的監察司、總監、總督、謀臣和省長，一同商議，請王立一條法例，實施一道禁令：無論何人，在三十天內，王啊！除了向你以外，若向任何神或任何人求甚麼，就必扔在獅子坑中。

words.note: Ancient official title.
High-ranking official title.
High-ranking official in ancient empires.
Officials who offer advice.
Governors of provinces in ancient Persian empire.
A command that prohibits something.
Often used with 除了...以外 to mean 'except for'.

verses.text: 王啊！現在求你立這禁令，簽署這份文告，使禁令不能更改。按照瑪代和波斯的律法，這樣的禁令是不能廢除的。」

words.note: A command that prohibits something.
A public announcement or decree.
A command that prohibits something.
Term for divine or human law, frequently in Bible.
A command that prohibits something.

verses.text: 於是大利烏王簽署了這禁令文告。

words.note: Used as a title after a king's name.
A command that prohibits something.
A public announcement or decree.

verses.text: 但以理照常禱告但以理知道這文告簽署了以後，就上到自己家裡樓頂上的房間，這房間的窗戶朝向耶路撒冷開著；他一日三次雙膝跪下，在他的 神面前禱告稱謝，像往日一樣。

words.note: A verb-object compound meaning 'to pray'.
A public announcement or decree.
More formal/literary than '天' for 'day'.
More formal way to say 'knees' or 'both knees'.
A reverential way of writing 'God' in Chinese Bibles.
A verb-object compound meaning 'to pray'.
To express gratitude or praise.

verses.text: 那些人相約前來，看見但以理在他的 神面前祈禱懇求。

words.note: The preceding space/square is a common convention in Chinese Bibles to emphasize 'God'.

verses.text: 他們就來到王面前，提起王的禁令，說：「你豈不是簽署了禁令，無論何人，在三十天內，王啊！除了向你以外，若向任何神或任何人求甚麼，就必扔在獅子坑中？」王回答說：「確有此事。按照瑪代和波斯的律法，這樣的禁令是不能廢除的。」

words.note: Indicates emphasis or a descriptive quality.

verses.text: 於是他們對王說：「王啊，在被擄的猶大人中的但以理不理會你的命令，也不理會你簽署的禁令，竟仍一日三次向他的 神祈求。」

words.note: The preceding space/square is a common convention in Chinese Bibles to emphasize 'God'.

verses.text: 王聽見了這話，就非常愁煩；他定意要搭救但以理，直到日落的時候，他還在設法營救但以理。
那些人就相約前來見王，對他說：「王啊，你該知道，根據瑪代和波斯的律法，王所立的禁令和法例，都是不能更改的。」

words.note: Indicates the object of the following verb.
Indicates emphasis or a descriptive quality.

verses.text: 但以理被扔在獅子坑中於是王下令，人就把但以理帶來，扔在獅子坑中。王對但以理說：「你常常事奉的 神，他必搭救你！」

words.note: Specific term for the biblical event.
Introduces the direct object before the verb.
The space before '神' indicates reverence in Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 有人搬了一塊石頭，放在坑口，王又蓋上自己的印鑒和眾大臣的印鑒，使懲辦但以理的事不得更改。

words.note: Here, it means 'cannot' or 'must not', often indicating prohibition or inability.

verses.text: 王回到宮裡，整夜沒有吃東西，也不要任何娛樂解悶，並且睡不著覺。

words.definition: did not have, there was no

words.note: Lit. 'east-west', meaning 'things' or 'stuff'; here, refers to food.
A common idiom meaning 'unable to fall asleep'.

verses.text: 次日黎明，天一亮，王就起來，急忙到獅子坑那裡去。

words.note: Used to connect two actions in quick succession (一...就...).

verses.text: 他走近坑邊的時候，就用哀痛的聲音呼叫但以理，對但以理說：「永活 神的僕人但以理啊！你常常事奉的 神能搭救你脫離獅子嗎？」
但以理毫無損傷但以理對王說：「願王萬歲！

words.note: Used as a direct address.
Lit. 'ten thousand years', an imperial salutation.

verses.text: 我的 神差遣了他的使者，封住獅子的口，使牠們沒有傷害我，因為我在 神面前是清白的；王啊！在你面前我也沒有作過任何錯事。」

words.note: In biblical context, often refers to an angel.
Used as a direct address.

verses.text: 王就非常高興，吩咐人把但以理從坑裡拉上來。於是但以理從坑裡被拉上來，他身上一點損傷也沒有，因為他信靠他的 神。

words.note: Lit. 'not common'.
Refers to the person's body or the person himself.

verses.text: 陷害但以理的人自食其果王下令，人就把那些誣衊控告但以理的人，連同他們的妻子和兒女都一起帶來，扔在獅子坑中；他們還沒有下到坑底，獅子就抓住他們，把他們所有的骨頭都咬碎了。

words.note: Idiom: 'to eat one's own fruit', meaning to suffer the consequences of one's own actions.

verses.text: 王通令全國敬畏 神後來大利烏王寫信給住在全地的各國、各族和說各種語言的人，說：「願你們大享平安！

words.note: Often used in formal or literary contexts like '大享平安' (may you enjoy great peace).
A common greeting and blessing.

verses.text: 現在我下令，我所統治的全國人民都要在但以理的 神面前戰兢恐懼。「他是永活的 神，他永遠長存；他的國度永不滅亡，他的統治直到永遠。

words.note: Indicates the following verb acts on the preceding noun.
The space before 神 is a traditional reverence marker in Chinese Bibles.
Often used in religious contexts describing reverence and fear.
The space before 神 is a traditional reverence marker in Chinese Bibles.
Often refers to God's or Christ's kingdom.

verses.text: 他搭救人，拯救人；他在天上地下施行神蹟奇事；他搭救了但以理脫離獅子的爪。」

words.note: Implies helping someone in distress.
Often paired with 奇事 (wonders).

verses.text: 於是這但以理在大利烏作王的時候，和在波斯人古列作王的時候（本句或譯：「於是這但以理在大利烏﹝即波斯人古列﹞作王的時候」），事事亨通。

words.note: Refers to people from Persia.
Reduplication emphasizes 'every single thing'.
